description: This notification indicates that the FEC seconds threshold
has been reached/exceeded for the referred xTU-C.

event.Summary: FEC threshold exceeded on xTU-C

description: Count of seconds during this interval that there was at least
one FEC correction event for one or more bearer channels in
this line. This parameter is inhibited during UAS or SES.
Unit: seconds
variables.name: HUAWEI-VDSL2-LINE-MIB::vdsl2PMLCurr15MFecs

description: A threshold for the vdsl2PMLCurr15MFecs counter
when vdsl2PMLCurrUnit is XTUC {1}.
The value 0 means that no threshold is specified for the
associated counter.
Unit: seconds
variables.name: HUAWEI-VDSL2-LINE-MIB::vdsl2LineAlarmConfProfileXtucThresh15MinFecs

description: This notification indicates that the FEC seconds threshold
has been reached/exceeded for the referred xTU-R.

event.Summary: FEC threshold exceeded on xTU-R

description: Count of seconds during this interval that there was at least
one FEC correction event for one or more bearer channels in
this line. This parameter is inhibited during UAS or SES.
Unit: seconds
variables.name: HUAWEI-VDSL2-LINE-MIB::vdsl2PMLCurr15MFecs

description: A threshold for the vdsl2PMLCurr15MFecs counter
when vdsl2PMLCurrUnit is XTUR {2}.
The value 0 means that no threshold is specified for the
associated counter.
Unit: seconds
variables.name: HUAWEI-VDSL2-LINE-MIB::vdsl2LineAlarmConfProfileXturThresh15MinFecs

description: This notification indicates that the errored seconds threshold
has been reached/exceeded for the referred xTU-C.

event.Summary: Errored seconds threshold exceeded on xTU-C

description: Count of seconds during this interval that there was:
xTU-C: CRC-8 >= 1 for one or more bearer channels OR
LOS >= 1 OR SEF >=1 OR LPR >= 1
xTU-R: FEBE >= 1 for one or more bearer channels OR
LOS-FE >=1 OR RDI >=1 OR LPR-FE >=1 .
This parameter is inhibited during UAS.
Unit: seconds
variables.name: HUAWEI-VDSL2-LINE-MIB::vdsl2PMLCurr15MEs

description: A threshold for the vdsl2PMLCurr15MEs counter
when vdsl2PMLCurrUnit is XTUC {1}.
The value 0 means that no threshold is specified for the
associated counter.
Unit: seconds
variables.name: HUAWEI-VDSL2-LINE-MIB::vdsl2LineAlarmConfProfileXtucThresh15MinEs

description: This notification indicates that the errored seconds threshold
has been reached/exceeded for the referred xTU-R.

event.Summary: Errored seconds threshold exceeded on xTU-R

description: Count of seconds during this interval that there was:
xTU-C: CRC-8 >= 1 for one or more bearer channels OR
LOS >= 1 OR SEF >=1 OR LPR >= 1
xTU-R: FEBE >= 1 for one or more bearer channels OR
LOS-FE >=1 OR RDI >=1 OR LPR-FE >=1 .
This parameter is inhibited during UAS.
Unit: seconds
variables.name: HUAWEI-VDSL2-LINE-MIB::vdsl2PMLCurr15MEs

description: A threshold for the vdsl2PMLCurr15MEs counter
when vdsl2PMLCurrUnit is XTUR {2}.
The value 0 means that no threshold is specified for the
associated counter.
Unit: seconds
variables.name: HUAWEI-VDSL2-LINE-MIB::vdsl2LineAlarmConfProfileXturThresh15MinEs

description: This notification indicates that the severely-errored seconds
threshold has been reached/exceeded for the referred xTU-C.

event.Summary: Severely errored seconds threshold exceeded on xTU-C

description: Count of seconds during this interval that there was:
xTU-C: If G.998.4 is supported and retransmission is enabled
in the near-end received direction, a SES is declared
if during a 1-second interval, there is one or more
severe loss of error-free throughput (seftr) defect
in the near-end received direction.
Or else, an SES is declared if, during a 1 second interval,
there are 18 or more CRC 8 anomalies in one or more of the
received bearer channels, or one or more LOS defects, or
one or more SEF defects, or one or more LPR defects.
xTU-R: If G.998.4 is supported and retransmission is enabled in the
far-end received direction, a SES-LFE is declared if during
a 1-second interval, there is one or more severe loss of
error-free throughput (seftr) defect in the far-end received
direction.
Or else, an SES is declared if, during a 1 second interval,
there are 18 or more FEBE anomalies in one or more of the
transmitted bearer channels, or one or more far end LOS
defects, or one or more RDI defects, or one or more LPR FE
defects.
This parameter is inhibited during UAS.
Unit: seconds
variables.name: HUAWEI-VDSL2-LINE-MIB::vdsl2PMLCurr15MSes

description: A threshold for the vdsl2PMLCurr15MSes counter
when vdsl2PMLCurrUnit is XTUC {1}.
The value 0 means that no threshold is specified for the
associated counter.
Unit: seconds
variables.name: HUAWEI-VDSL2-LINE-MIB::vdsl2LineAlarmConfProfileXtucThresh15MinSes

description: This notification indicates that the severely-errored seconds
threshold has been reached/exceeded for the referred xTU-R.

event.Summary: Severely errored seconds threshold exceeded on xTU-R

description: Count of seconds during this interval that there was:
xTU-C: If G.998.4 is supported and retransmission is enabled
in the near-end received direction, a SES is declared
if during a 1-second interval, there is one or more
severe loss of error-free throughput (seftr) defect
in the near-end received direction.
Or else, an SES is declared if, during a 1 second interval,
there are 18 or more CRC 8 anomalies in one or more of the
received bearer channels, or one or more LOS defects, or
one or more SEF defects, or one or more LPR defects.
xTU-R: If G.998.4 is supported and retransmission is enabled in the
far-end received direction, a SES-LFE is declared if during
a 1-second interval, there is one or more severe loss of
error-free throughput (seftr) defect in the far-end received
direction.
Or else, an SES is declared if, during a 1 second interval,
there are 18 or more FEBE anomalies in one or more of the
transmitted bearer channels, or one or more far end LOS
defects, or one or more RDI defects, or one or more LPR FE
defects.
This parameter is inhibited during UAS.
Unit: seconds
variables.name: HUAWEI-VDSL2-LINE-MIB::vdsl2PMLCurr15MSes

description: A threshold for the vdsl2PMLCurr15MSes counter
when vdsl2PMLCurrUnit is XTUR {2}.
The value 0 means that no threshold is specified for the
associated counter.
Unit: seconds
variables.name: HUAWEI-VDSL2-LINE-MIB::vdsl2LineAlarmConfProfileXturThresh15MinSes

description: This notification indicates that the LOS seconds
threshold has been reached/exceeded for the referred xTU-C.

event.Summary: LOS seconds threshold exceeded on xTU-C

description: Count of seconds during this interval that there was LOS (or
LOS-FE for xTU-R).
Unit: seconds
variables.name: HUAWEI-VDSL2-LINE-MIB::vdsl2PMLCurr15MLoss

description: A threshold for the vdsl2PMLCurr15MLoss counter
when vdsl2PMLCurrUnit is XTUC {1}.
The value 0 means that no threshold is specified for the
associated counter.
Unit: seconds
variables.name: HUAWEI-VDSL2-LINE-MIB::vdsl2LineAlarmConfProfileXtucThresh15MinLoss

description: This notification indicates that the LOS seconds
threshold has been reached/exceeded for the referred xTU-R.

event.Summary: LOS seconds threshold exceeded on xTU-R

description: Count of seconds during this interval that there was LOS (or
LOS-FE for xTU-R).
Unit: seconds
variables.name: HUAWEI-VDSL2-LINE-MIB::vdsl2PMLCurr15MLoss

description: A threshold for the vdsl2PMLCurr15MLoss counter
when vdsl2PMLCurrUnit is XTUR {2}.
The value 0 means that no threshold is specified for the
associated counter.
Unit: seconds
variables.name: HUAWEI-VDSL2-LINE-MIB::vdsl2LineAlarmConfProfileXturThresh15MinLoss

description: This notification indicates that the unavailable seconds
threshold has been reached/exceeded for the referred xTU-C.

event.Summary: Unavailable seconds threshold exceeded on xTU-C

description: Count of seconds in Unavailability State during this
interval. Unavailability begins at the onset of 10
contiguous severely-errored seconds, and ends at the
onset of 10 contiguous seconds with no severely-errored
seconds.
Unit: seconds
variables.name: HUAWEI-VDSL2-LINE-MIB::vdsl2PMLCurr15MUas

description: A threshold for the vdsl2PMLCurr15MUas counter
when vdsl2PMLCurrUnit is XTUC {1}.
The value 0 means that no threshold is specified for the
associated counter.
Unit: seconds
variables.name: HUAWEI-VDSL2-LINE-MIB::vdsl2LineAlarmConfProfileXtucThresh15MinUas

description: This notification indicates that the unavailable seconds
threshold has been reached/exceeded for the referred xTU-R.

event.Summary: Unavailable seconds threshold exceeded on xTU-R

description: Count of seconds in Unavailability State during this
interval. Unavailability begins at the onset of 10
contiguous severely-errored seconds, and ends at the
onset of 10 contiguous seconds with no severely-errored
seconds.
Unit: seconds
variables.name: HUAWEI-VDSL2-LINE-MIB::vdsl2PMLCurr15MUas

description: A threshold for the vdsl2PMLCurr15MUas counter
when vdsl2PMLCurrUnit is XTUR {2}.
The value 0 means that no threshold is specified for the
associated counter.
Unit: seconds
variables.name: HUAWEI-VDSL2-LINE-MIB::vdsl2LineAlarmConfProfileXturThresh15MinUas

description: This notification indicates that the coding violations
threshold has been reached/exceeded for the referred xTU-C.

event.Summary: Coding violation threshold exceeded on xTU-C

description: Count of CRC-8 (FEBE for xTU-R) anomalies occurring in the
channel during the interval. This parameter is inhibited
during UAS or SES. If the CRC is applied over multiple
channels, then each related CRC-8 (or FEBE) anomaly should
increment each of the counters related to the individual
channels.
variables.name: HUAWEI-VDSL2-LINE-MIB::vdsl2PMChCurr15MCodingViolations

description: A threshold for the vdsl2PMChCurr15MCodingViolations
counter, when vdsl2PMChCurrUnit is XTUC {1}.
The value 0 means that no threshold is specified for the
associated counter.
variables.name: HUAWEI-VDSL2-LINE-MIB::vdsl2ChAlarmConfProfileXtucThresh15MinCodingViolations

description: This notification indicates that the coding violations
threshold has been reached/exceeded for the referred xTU-R.

event.Summary: Coding violation threshold exceeded on xTU-R

description: Count of CRC-8 (FEBE for xTU-R) anomalies occurring in the
channel during the interval. This parameter is inhibited
during UAS or SES. If the CRC is applied over multiple
channels, then each related CRC-8 (or FEBE) anomaly should
increment each of the counters related to the individual
channels.
variables.name: HUAWEI-VDSL2-LINE-MIB::vdsl2PMChCurr15MCodingViolations

description: A threshold for the vdsl2PMChCurr15MCodingViolations
counter, when vdsl2PMChCurrUnit is XTUR {2}.
The value 0 means that no threshold is specified for the
associated counter.
variables.name: HUAWEI-VDSL2-LINE-MIB::vdsl2ChAlarmConfProfileXturThresh15MinCodingViolations

description: This notification indicates that the corrected blocks
(FEC events) threshold has been reached/exceeded for the
referred xTU-C.

event.Summary: Corrected blocks threshold exceeded on xTU-C

description: Count of FEC (FFEC for xTU-R) anomalies (corrected code words)
occurring in the channel during the interval. This parameter
is inhibited during UAS or SES. If the FEC is applied over
multiple channels, then each related FEC (or FFEC) anomaly
should increment each of the counters related to the
individual channels.
variables.name: HUAWEI-VDSL2-LINE-MIB::vdsl2PMChCurr15MCorrectedBlocks

description: A threshold for the vdsl2PMChCurr15MCorrectedBlocks
counter, when vdsl2PMChCurrUnit is XTUC {1}.
The value 0 means that no threshold is specified for the
associated counter.
variables.name: HUAWEI-VDSL2-LINE-MIB::vdsl2ChAlarmConfProfileXtucThresh15MinCorrected

description: This notification indicates that the corrected blocks
(FEC events) threshold has been reached/exceeded for the
referred xTU-R.

event.Summary: Corrected blocks threshold exceeded on xTU-R

description: Count of FEC (FFEC for xTU-R) anomalies (corrected code words)
occurring in the channel during the interval. This parameter
is inhibited during UAS or SES. If the FEC is applied over
multiple channels, then each related FEC (or FFEC) anomaly
should increment each of the counters related to the
individual channels.
variables.name: HUAWEI-VDSL2-LINE-MIB::vdsl2PMChCurr15MCorrectedBlocks

description: A threshold for the vdsl2PMChCurr15MCorrectedBlocks
counter, when vdsl2PMChCurrUnit is XTUR {2}.
The value 0 means that no threshold is specified for the
associated counter.
variables.name: HUAWEI-VDSL2-LINE-MIB::vdsl2ChAlarmConfProfileXturThresh15MinCorrected

description: This notification indicates that the failed full
initializations threshold has been reached/exceeded for the
referred VDSL/VDSL2 or VDSL2 line.

event.Summary: Failed initialization threshold exceeded on VDSL line

description: Count of failed full initializations on the line during this
interval.
variables.name: HUAWEI-VDSL2-LINE-MIB::vdsl2PMLCurrInit15MFailedFullInits

description: A threshold for the vdsl2PMLCurrInit15MfailedFullInits
counter.
The value 0 means that no threshold is specified for the
associated counter.
variables.name: HUAWEI-VDSL2-LINE-MIB::vdsl2LineAlarmConfProfileThresh15MinFailedFullInt

description: This notification indicates that the failed short
initializations threshold has been reached/exceeded for the
referred VDSL or VDSL2 line.

event.Summary: Short initialization failure threshold exceeded on VDSL line

description: Count of failed short initializations on the line during this
interval.
variables.name: HUAWEI-VDSL2-LINE-MIB::vdsl2PMLCurrInit15MFailedShortInits

description: A threshold for the vdsl2PMLCurrInit15MFailedShortInits
counter.
The value 0 means that no threshold is specified for the
associated counter.
variables.name: HUAWEI-VDSL2-LINE-MIB::vdsl2LineAlarmConfProfileThresh15MinFailedShrtInt

description: This notification indicates that a status change is
detected for the referred xTU-C.

event.Summary: Referred xTU-C status changed

description: Indicates current state (existing failures) of the xTU-C.
This is a bit-map of possible conditions. This BITS structure can
report the following failures:
1. noDefect (0) - This bit position positively reports
that no defect or failure exist
2. lossOfFraming (1) - Loss of frame synchronization
3. lossOfSignal (2) - Loss of signal
4. lossOfPower (3) - Loss of power. Usually this failure may
be reported for CPE units only
5. initFailure (4) - Recent initialization process failed
variables.name: HUAWEI-VDSL2-LINE-MIB::vdsl2LineStatusXtuc

description: This notification indicates that a status change is
detected for the referred xTU-R.

event.Summary: Referred xTU-R status changed

description: Indicates current state (existing failures) of the xTU-R.
This is a bit-map of possible conditions. The various bit
positions are: noFailure(0), lossOfFraming(1)
lossOfSignal(2), lossOfPower(3)
initFailure(4) - never active on xTU-R
variables.name: HUAWEI-VDSL2-LINE-MIB::vdsl2LineStatusXtur

description: This notification indicates that the full
initializations threshold has been reached/exceeded for the
referred VDSL/VDSL2 or VDSL2 line.

event.Summary: Full initializations threshold exceeded on VDSL line

description: Count of full initializations attempted on the line
(successful and failed) during this interval.
variables.name: HUAWEI-VDSL2-LINE-MIB::vdsl2PMLCurrInit15MFullInits

description: A threshold for the vdsl2PMLCurrInit15MFullInits
counter.
The value 0 means that no threshold is specified for the
associated counter.
variables.name: HUAWEI-VDSL2-LINE-MIB::vdsl2LineAlarmConfProfileThresh15MinFullInt

description: VDSL mode switch trap.
This trap message is generated when the VDSL line mode fails
to be switched.

Summary.eval: ($v1 == 0) ? 'VDSL line mode successfully switched' : 'VDSL line mode failed to switch'

description: VDSL mode switch result.
Options:
1. success(0) - success
2. fail(1) - fail
variables.name: HUAWEI-VDSL2-LINE-MIB::hwvdsl2ModeSwitchResult

description: VDSL current mode trap.
This trap message is generated when the current mode of the VDSL
line is reported to the NMS periodically.

event.Summary: VDSL management mode changed to $v1

description: This object is used to change VDSL management mode.
After the mode being changed, system will automatically
save data and reboot.
variables.name: HUAWEI-VDSL2-LINE-MIB::hwvdslmodecfg

description: VDSL port status change trap.
This trap message is generated when the port status changes,
for example from up to down or from down to up.The parameter
information about the trap message describes the current
status of the link and the location where the trap message
is generated.

event.Summary: VDSL port status changed to $v4

tests: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-VDSL2-LINE-MIB::hwvdsl2PortStatusChangeTrap HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwFrameIndex i 0 HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwSlotIndex i 0 HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwPortIndex i 0 HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwPortOperStatus i 2 HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwPortPrimaryStatus i 1 HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwPortSecondaryStatus b 0

$SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-VDSL2-LINE-MIB::hwvdsl2PortStatusChangeTrap HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwFrameIndex i 0 HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwSlotIndex i 0 HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwPortIndex i 0 HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwPortOperStatus i 1 HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwPortPrimaryStatus i 1 HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwPortSecondaryStatus b 0

description: The index of a shelf in the device.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwFrameIndex

description: A slot index is used to identify the location of a board in a shelf.
You can locate a board in a shelf according to hwFrameIndex and hwSlotIndex.
For the hwFrameIndex object, refer to hwFrameTable.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwSlotIndex

description: Port index, indicating the physical number of the port on a board.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwPortIndex

description: Port operation status.
Options:
1.normal(1) -indicates that the link is up or activated
2.fault(2) -indicates that port failure
3.localLoopback(3) -indicates that normal local loopback
4.forbidden(4) -indicates that the port is disabled
5.test(5) -indicates test start
6.remoteLoopback(6) -indicates normal remote loopback
7.activated(10) -indicates that the port is being activated
8.deactivated(11) -indicates that the link is down or deactivated
9.block(12) -indicates port blocking
10.nolight(13) -indicates no signal in ATM port
11.innerLocalLoopback(14) -indicates that inner local loopback toward inner system chipset (it's UTOPIA loopback for ADSL port)
12.innerRemoteLoopback(15)-indicates that inner remote loopback toward inner system chipset
13.locked(16) -indicates locked
14.busy(17) -indicates busy
15.maintain(18) -indicates maintenance
16.standbynormal(19) -indicates that the port on the standby control board is activated
17.standbyfault(20) -indicates that the port on the standby control board is faulty
18.adslloopbackafe(21) -indicates that AFE loopback
19.adslloopbackhybrid(22) -indicates that HYBRID loopback
20.rtuLocalLoopback(23) -indicates that RTU local loopback
21.rtuRemoteLoopback(24) -indicates that RTU remote loopback
22.linkup(25) -indicates eth port online
23.linkdown(26) -indicates eth port offline
24.powerDenied(50) -indicates port operation state is power denied
variables.name: HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwPortOperStatus

description: The primary status of the port.
Options:
1. isNr(1) -in Service, normal
2. isAnr(2) -in service, abnormal
3. isRst(3) -in service, restricted
4. isAnrst(4) -in service, abnormal & restricted
5. oosAu(5) -out of service, autonomous
6. oosMa(6) -out of service, management
7. oosAuma(7) -out of service, autonomous & management
8. oosAurst(8) -out of service, autonomous & restricted
9. oosMaanr(9) -out of service, management & abnormal
variables.name: HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwPortPrimaryStatus

description: The secondary status of the port.
This BITS structure can report the following status:
1. sstAins(0) -this bit position positively reports that the status of the port is automatic in-service
2. sstFaf(1) -facility failure
3. sstFlt(2) -fault
4. sstLpbk(3) -loopback
5. sstMea(4) -mismatch of equipment and attributes
6. sstSgeo(5) -supporting entity outage
7. sstStbyh(6) -standby-Hot
8. sstTs(7) -test
9. sstUas(8) -unassigned
10. sstUeq(9) -unequipped
11. sstWrk(10) -working
12. sstPwr(11) -power
variables.name: HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwPortSecondaryStatus

description: VDSL delt trap.
This trap message is generated when the result of the DELT performed
on the VDSL line is reported.

event.Summary: VDSL delt operation result reported

description: Request ID
variables.name: HUAWEI-VDSL2-LINE-MIB::hwVdsl2RequestID

description: The status of the recent occasion the Loop diagnostics mode
forced (LDSF) was issued for the associated line.
Options:
1. none(1) - The default value in case LDSF was never
requested for the associated line
2. success(2) - The recent command completed
successfully
3. inProgress(3) - The Loop Diagnostics process is in
progress
4. unsupported(4) - The NE or the line card doesn't support
LDSF
5. cannotRun(5) - The NE cannot initiate the command, due
to a non specific reason
6. aborted(6) - The Loop Diagnostics process aborted
7. failed(7) - The Loop Diagnostics process failed
8. illegalMode(8) - The NE cannot initiate the command, due
to the specific mode of the relevant
line
9. adminUp(9) - The NE cannot initiate the command, as
the relevant line is administratively
'Up'
10.tableFull(10) - The NE cannot initiate the command, due
to reaching the maximum number of rows
in the results table
11.noResources(11) - The NE cannot initiate the command, due
to lack of internal memory resources
Default: none(1)
variables.name: HUAWEI-VDSL2-LINE-MIB::vdsl2LineCmndConfLdsfFailReason

description: A unique value, greater than zero, for each interface. It
is recommended that values are assigned contiguously
starting from 1. The value for each interface sub-layer
must remain constant at least from one re-initialization of
the entity's network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifIndex

description: VDSL template change trap.
This trap message is generated when the VDSL templete changed.

event.Summary: VDSL template ($v2) changed

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-VDSL2-LINE-MIB::hwvdsl2TemplateIDChangeTrap HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwConfigChangeIP a 192.0.2.1 HUAWEI-VDSL2-LINE-MIB::hwVdsl2TemplateType i 1 IF-MIB::ifIndex i 9999 HUAWEI-XDSL-COMMON-MIB::hwXdslProfName s EXAMPLE

description: The serial IP of configuration changes.
If the configuration changes is trigger by the command line users, the IP address is 0.0.0.0.
If it is triggered by the SNMP user, the IP address is the SNMP user's IP address.
The Trap of configuration changes will not be sent to the SNMP user
who triggered the configuration changes.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwConfigChangeIP

description: Type of the VDSL template ID.
Options:
1. lineConfTemplate(1) - VDSL2 line template
2. alarmConfTemplate(2) - VDSL2 alarm template
3. spectrumProf(3) - VDSL2 spectrum profile
4. dpboProf(4) - VDSL2 dpbo profile
5. upboProf(5) - VDSL2 upbo profile
6. serviceProf(6) - VDSL2 service profile
7. noiseMarginProf(7) - VDSL2 noise-margin profile
8. delayInpProf(8) - VDSL2 delay-inp profile
variables.name: HUAWEI-VDSL2-LINE-MIB::hwVdsl2TemplateType

description: A unique value, greater than zero, for each interface. It
is recommended that values are assigned contiguously
starting from 1. The value for each interface sub-layer
must remain constant at least from one re-initialization of
the entity's network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifIndex

description: The name of the XDSL profile.
variables.name: HUAWEI-XDSL-COMMON-MIB::hwXdslProfName

description: This trap message is generated when some xDSL ports or all the xDSL ports
are automatically deactivated due to lack of licenses.

event.Summary: XDSL ports deactivated due to license shortage

description: The index of a shelf in the device.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwFrameIndex

description: A slot index is used to identify the location of a board in a shelf.
You can locate a board in a shelf according to hwFrameIndex and hwSlotIndex.
For the hwFrameIndex object, refer to hwFrameTable.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwSlotIndex

description: This trap message is generated when the VDSL port is automatically
deactivated due to the line fault.

event.Summary: VDSL port deactivated due to line fault

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-VDSL2-LINE-MIB::hwvdsl2PortAutoDeactiveLineFaultAlarmTrap HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwFrameIndex i 0 HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwSlotIndex i 0 HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwPortIndex i 0

description: The index of a shelf in the device.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwFrameIndex

description: A slot index is used to identify the location of a board in a shelf.
You can locate a board in a shelf according to hwFrameIndex and hwSlotIndex.
For the hwFrameIndex object, refer to hwFrameTable.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwSlotIndex

description: Port index, indicating the physical number of the port on a board.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwPortIndex

description: This trap message is generated when the VDSL port is re-activated
after the VDSL line recovers.

event.Summary: VDSL port re-activated after line recovery

description: The index of a shelf in the device.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwFrameIndex

description: A slot index is used to identify the location of a board in a shelf.
You can locate a board in a shelf according to hwFrameIndex and hwSlotIndex.
For the hwFrameIndex object, refer to hwFrameTable.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwSlotIndex

description: Port index, indicating the physical number of the port on a board.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwPortIndex

description: Provides the bearer channel number associated with this
row (i.e., the channel ifIndex).
This enables determining the channel configuration profile
and the channel thresholds profile applicable for this
bearer channel.
variables.name: HUAWEI-VDSL2-LINE-MIB::vdsl2ChStatusChannelNum

description: If retransmission is not used in a given transmit direction,
this parameter reports the actual net data rate at which the
bearer channel is operating in L0 power management state, and
in L1 or L2 states, the parameter contains the net data rate
in the previous L0 state.
If retransmission is used in a given transmit direction,
this parameter reports the Expected Throughput(ETR) at which the
bearer channel is operating in L0 power management state, and in
L1 or L2 states, the parameter contains the Expected Throughput(ETR)
in the previous L0 state.
The data rate is coded in steps of 1000 bit/s.
The invalid value is 4294967295. If data on the port is invalid
or no data is generated on the port because the port has not been
activated, the invalid value will be returned.
Unit: bits/second
variables.name: HUAWEI-VDSL2-LINE-MIB::vdsl2ChStatusActDataRate

description: This trap message is generated when it fails to activate the port
by using the VDSL line configuration parameters.

event.Summary: Active port failed due to $v4
